actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-201, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3040 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means now printed in the bill as an original bill for the purpose of amendment and all points of order against said substitute shall be waived. No amendment to the substitute shall be in order except those printed in the report accompanying this resolution. Said amendments shall be considered in the order, manner, and debatable as specified in the report and not subject to amendment. All points of order against the amendments printed in the report shall be waived.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 53.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 141 (Roll no. 259).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 128 (Roll no. 260).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3040) to provide a program of Federal supplemental compensation, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 3040 (Federal supplemental unemployment compensation program).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3040) to provide a program of Federal supplemental compensation, and for other purposes.
